# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function as per the given task:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for word in split(text)
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
        end
        wrapped_text *= word * " "
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example
wrapped_text = wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines", 12)
println(wrapped_text)
```

In this example, the `wrap_string` function is called with a text string and a `text_width` of 12 characters. The resulting wrapped text is then printed.
